citation.article-title: Mesoflavibacter zeaxanthinifaciens gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel zeaxanthin-producing marine bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae.

p.s: Description of M. zeaxanthinifaciens sp. nov.
M. zeaxanthinifaciens (ze.a.xan.thi.ni.fa’ci.ens. N.L. neut. n. zeaxanthinum zeaxanthin; L. part. pres. faciens making/producing; N.L. part. adj. zeaxanthinifaciens zeaxanthin-producing)
Displays the following characteristics in addition to those given in the genus description.

Cells are 0.3–0.4 μm in width and 0.75–5.3 μm in length, growing singly, in pairs or short chains; some cells show the presence of vesicle-like microstructures and can be connected by thread-like structures.
Colonies on marine agar are circular, convex, smooth and contain non-diffusible yellow carotenoid pigments with zeaxanthin as the major component.
Growth occurs between 16 and 44 °C (optimum, 35–37 °C) and pH 5.5 and 11.0 (optimum, 7.0–8.0).
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 4–6% NaCl but growth does not occur in the absence of NaCl or in the presence of greater than 10% NaCl.
Aesculin, Tween 80, gelatin, casein and starch are hydrolysed but agar, DNA, cellulose and chitin are not.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
Arginine dihydrolase and β-galactosidase are positive.
Tryptophan deaminase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and urease activities are negative.
Acid is produced from glucose, mannose, aesculin, starch, glycogen and 5-keto gluconate.
Mannose and mannitol are assimilated, but glucose, N-acetyl-glucosamine, gluconate, arabinose, capric acid, adipic acid, malate, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid are not.

The DNA G+C content is 32.0 mol% and the dominant fatty acids (representing 75.4% of the total fatty acids) are iso-C15:1 G, iso-C15:0, iso-C16:0 3-OH, iso-C15:0 3-OH, Summed feature 3 (containing iso-C15:0 2-OH and/or C16:1ω7c), iso-C17:0 3-OH and C15:0.
The type strain is TD-ZX30T (=NBRC 102119=CCUG 53614=DSM 18436), and it was isolated from a shallow seawater sample collected on the Pacific coastline of Japan near Kamakura City.
